intro: Trichophyllum oppositifolium, commonly known as the opposite-leafed moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit and small, closely packed leaves that are arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in rocky or forested areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a smooth or slightly serrated margin. Trichophyllum oppositifolium plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
